name: Novotel Chateau de Maffliers

reviews.text: First let me say that this hotel is a bit different from others. It's built upon the grounds of a castle, so there's considerably more expense in maintaining the grounds as well as the actual hotel, which is in a secondary building. The morning breakfast is served at an annex to the main building, and the grounds make for a very nice walk and a sense of serenity - you can watch people play ping pong or see the horses being taken care of, or just sit out in the sun.
reviews.title: Gotta be a hassle to run a castle

likes.liked: — The cheerful person at the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mention so much about the setting because our stay was a bit of a study in contrast. First, I must mention, the front desk person was a delightful young gal who always had a smile, no matter what the situation and was genuinely concerned with helping. However, all of her good intentions still didn't end up resulting in a completely satisfactory stay.
reviews.title: Nice, but nothing special

likes.liked: — quiet location with beautiful park and chateau

reviews.text: First, I have an issue with the Novotel site and its mention of WiFi availability - there was no mention of the somewhat hefty charge. Second, there were only enough towels in a 3 person room for one person - no facecloths! Apparently Novotel doesn't supply them. Maybe it's a European thing. We asked for more towels to be delivered the next day. They didn't show so we had to request again.
reviews.title: Wonderful venue

reviews.text: On our second day there, a Sunday, the shower broke. It would not stay up. The front desk said they'd be happy to have it fixed. Monday. Because they had no handyman or any engineering on Sunday. Of course France has some interesting issues with Sunday - you can buy a new deck, a barbecue, and the tools for it, but you can't buy any food at a grocery store. So - not sure why engineering gets a day off, but try not to have problems on Sunday.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our one night here

likes.liked: — Standard of furnishing in the rooms, breakfast, friendly reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The charming lady at the front desk ultimately did offer us a buffet breakfast by way of apology, and sent us to go partake, only to find out they'd closed the buffet 1/2 hr before the front desk said it was supposed to be closed. Luckily, there were some things left.
reviews.title: Great value, relaxing location...

likes.liked: — Situated in a great park, easy parking, green and peaceful

reviews.text: I have stayed in several Novotels in the Paris Area, this hotel is by far the worst I stayed in. The rooms are old, dusty and they smell terrible. There are no facilities like a bar or restaurant in the hotel itself, therefore you need to walk to the nearby "chateau". In the hotel itself it is not possible to get a cup of coffee, tea or even some water or other sodas. The beds are problably 40 years old, which you will feel the morning after, if you are able to catch some sleep. Bathroom is pretty old as well. If travelling to this area I would prefer the Cergy Pontoise Novotel.
reviews.title: very misleading pictures

likes.disliked: — everything between the checkin and checkout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The picture is misleading - the chateau is just the restaurant/conference centre, and the rooms are in an anonymous modern block close by. But: although the rooms are ordinary, they are quite modern, very clean and comfortable, the staff are super (helpful and friendly) and the whole lot is set in acres of blissfully peaceful parkland.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Staff were rude and arrogant, definitely would not go there again. The Novotel is completely different to the Chateau advertised on the Novotel Website. WOULD NEVER recommend
reviews.title: Nothing like the picture

reviews.text: I booked this place, because I had to be in the neighbourhood for business purposes and I took Novotel, because you always know what to expect. BUT, this was far better than what I could expect. Novotel Chateau de Maffliers is the only chateau-hotel under the Novotel Brand, mostly chateaus are turned into a Mercure. The setting: very rural, on the site of a chateau, which is part of the hotel. In the Chateau, there is the bar, meeting rooms and the restaurant, swimming pool (indoors heated) and small gym. The hotel has a private walking track also on site. The hotel itself has the typical Novotel decoration unfortunately, because rooms at Novotel are never sound isolated, so you can hear your neighbours snore!
reviews.title: Lovely place, nice setting and close to Paris!!!

aka: Novotel Chateau De Maffliers Hotel Maffliers
description: The Novotel Chateau de Maffliers is located 20 minutes from Roissy CDG Airport, 18 km north of Paris and close to LIsle Adam. Ideal for seminars and meetings, this 19th century chateau features 11 conference rooms for 2 to 100 people. Whether travellingon business or on a holiday, enjoy our indoor pool, tennis courts, English style bar and 35 hectares of private gardens. With contemporary style the Novotelcafe offers an original and varied menu. Ask about our special packages.
